sub_topic: Using the power rule to differentiate functions
message_2:
To find the derivative f'(x) of the function f(x) = 5x^3, we will use the power rule. The power rule states that if f(x) = x^n, then f'(x) = nx^(n-1).

In this case, n = 3. So, applying the power rule:

f'(x) = 3 * 5x^(3-1)
f'(x) = 15x^2
